But knowing you, working on this for you, and myself, I can feel a little of it coming back. McCaleb smiles, a bit embarrassed. It’s the best he can explain. Graciella reaches down, strokes his cheek with the back of her hand. The door opens and Dr. Fox enters carrying a computer printout. She holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOX
dialogues.text: It’s the list of local AB CMW negatives. Cordell’s on it. Same blood type as Torres. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Two names on the list have been highlighted by Dr. Fox: Gloria Torres & James Cordell. They both have a "D" next to their names. Most names on the list do not. McCALEB What’s the ‘D’ mean? Deceased?

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOX
dialogues.text: No. The ‘D’ means donor. Organ donor. They were both organ donors. The words hang heavy in the air. McCALEB That’s why they were killed. Cordell died on the scene, but Gloria made it long enough. Dr. Fox follows his reasoning. She’s stunned.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOX
dialogues.text: That’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What are you saying? McCALEB I made a judgement. I decided your sister didn’t have anything anyone would want so the reason had to be elsewhere. I missed it.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Missed what, McCaleb? Before McCaleb can answer, Dr. Fox does.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOX
dialogues.text: Her blood. It made her unique. It made what was inside her very valuable... to someone. McCALEB Someone like me. Anyone who benefitted could be a suspect.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: You’re saying she was murdered for her organs? The final piece falls into place for McCaleb. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB (as it hits him) The autopsy reports. Both bullets went through the frontal lobe. The shooter wanted them brain-dead, but didn’t want them to die right away. Cordell was alive, but 9-1-1 screwed up the address. But your sister had the good samaritan.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Who? McCALEB A customer who came in and bandaged her, then called 9-1-1. It hits him like a ton of bricks. He bolts to his feet. McCALEB I need to use the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOX
dialogues.text: Terry, lay back down! You can’t get up until -- McCALEB Just get me a list of where the organs went. With that, he’s out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked pulls up and Jaye Winston gets out. She’s met by Graciella who shrugs and directs her inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Kang watches, confused as McCaleb stands by the video surveillance camera recorder, a phone in his hand. McCALEB (into phone) This is Arrango, West Valley Homicide. Badge number one-four-one-one. I need a ten-twenty for a surveillance commencement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat. McCaleb stares at the time readout on the surveillance camera. It’s 5:14:42 p.m. as:

dialogues.speaker: TELEPHONE VOICE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: That’s seventeen-fourteen- thirty-nine. McCALEB Gotcha. Thanks. McCaleb hangs up just as Jaye and Graciella come around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: I’m out of my jurisdiction, McCaleb. What’s up? McCALEB This surveillance camera is 3 seconds behind the CCW clock. (to Graciella) That’s the clock 9-1-1 uses.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: So? McCALEB Did you bring the tapes?

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: In the car.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 82 EXT. SHERMAN MARKET - IN JAYE’S CAR - DAY 82 Jaye pops a CASSETTE TAPE into the car tape deck. McCaleb sits in front beside her. Graciella is in the back seat. Over the CAR SPEAKERS:

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the 9-1-1 operator.

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Hispanic; scared) The girl is shot very bad. She needs help please.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Who was shot, sir? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The girl is shot. Sherman Market. Sherman Way. As the LINE CLICKS OFF...

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sir? Please stay on the line. Sir? Graciella hangs her head. McCaleb ejects the tape. He reviews the 9-1-1 report, circles the time the call came in: 10:40:58 p.m. He writes it down on a pad of paper... McCALEB 10:40:58. 9-1-1 call. (to Jaye) Give me the camera. She hands him a handheld video camera with the flip-open LCD screens. The tape is from the market camera. It’s the Gloria Torres murder for the umpteenth time. The gun goes to her head. McCaleb freezes it just as she’s shot. His finger stabs down on the security camera time readout: 10:41:37. He writes down under the first time... McCALEB 10:41:37 -- Gloria Torres shot. McCaleb fast-forwards and freezes where the good samaritan enters. McCALEB 10:42:55 p.m. Good samaritan. McCaleb pounds his fist into his palm. Once, twice, three times. As Jaye realizes...

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: That sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What...? What? McCaleb points at the good samaritan. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCALEB See this guy? Unidentified good Samaritan. He tried to help the victim and then took off. There’s just one problem.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: The clock on the surveillance camera is only three seconds off the 9-1-1 clock. He made the call before your sister got shot.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: But that doesn’t make any sense. McCaleb doesn’t answer. Neither does Jaye. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. The caller -- it’s the same guy. (gasping) He called the ambulance before he shot her. McCaleb stares at the frozen good Samaritan. The image, McCALEB Cordell died and his organs were no good. The next time the shooter wanted to make sure. So he got the ambulance started on the way. Then he shot Gloria, then he came back inside to bandage her. To keep her alive.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Could this good Samaritan be the guy you saw at the bank? At the A.T.M. machine? as it always has been, is very grainy and we never get a great look. McCALEB I don’t know. Put a wig on him and maybe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: (re: Good Sam) A little dark makeup and this guy’s Hispanic. McCALEB (suddenly) You got the other tape. The A.T.M. tape?

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: No. You only asked for this one. McCALEB Maybe the shooter did the same thing at the A.T.M. He calls an ambulance, but they get the address wrong. Could this guy be Lockeridge? Jaye studies the screen.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Maybe. McCALEB Whoever got the list of organ donors had to hack into the BOPRA system. Lockeridge works with computers.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: He lives in my jurisdiction. McCaleb looks back at Graciella.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: I want to come with you. McCALEB Go back to Raymond. He’s your job; this is mine. She looks at him a beat, then finally nods. McCALEB You take the car. I/’11 go with Jaye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Office Manager (seen earlier) steps over to where Jaye and McCaleb wait.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE MANAGER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but Mr. Lockeridge didn’t come into work today. McCALEB Is he ill?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE MANAGER
dialogues.text: (shrugs) To be honest, he hasn’t called and he didn’t come in yesterday, either. Jaye and McCaleb exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. LOCKERIDGE’S HOUSE - DAY 84 Jaye and McCaleb walk up the front steps. Jaye hits the BUZZER. As they wait, McCaleb leans over the porch rail, looking in the living room window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of bare feet and legs disappearing behind a sofa.

dialogues.speaker: PORCH 86
dialogues.text: McCaleb draws his .38, motions Jaye over. As she looks. McCALEB That looks like probable cause to me. Jaye draws her gun as well. As she pulls back the front screen door... McCALEB Let’s see if I remember how this goes... McCaleb rears back, kicks the front door in. He remembers.  87 88 89 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE WITH McCaleb as he sweeps left and Jaye disappears right. The house is small enough and in a few moments McCaleb meets Jaye back by the body. We don’t get a clear view, but it’s a woman. Jaye kneels beside her a moment, then looks up at McCaleb, who’s trying to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Her throat’s been slit... and she’s been here a good 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police lines have been set up. The coroner is here along with several uniforms and a couple of detectives. They confer with Jaye, who then heads over to where... McCaleb sits on the curb, his head in his hands. He looks up as Jaye touches his shoulder. McCaleb looks ragged.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: We got an A.P.B. out on Lockeridge. You did good, McCaleb. McCALEB We’ll see. I got to get home and take my pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat, McCaleb makes his way. A HARMONICA RIFF drifts off the Double-Down. Buddy raises the usual beer as McCaleb passes.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (re: Following Sea) You still got company. McCALEB Thanks. How much beer do I owe you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Seven cases. But he’s a good kid and a helluva fisherman. I/’11 take two. McCALEB You got it. And I’1l bring your check by in the morning. As McCaleb continues...

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: That’s what they all say. Good night, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond is at McCaleb’s desk, doing his math homework. Graciella fillets fish at the sink. They look up as McCaleb steps through the slider.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. McCaleb. McCALEB Hey, Raymond. Call me Terry.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Me and Buddy caught six fish. McCALEB That’s great. A harbor record I think.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Finish your homework, Ray. Rolling his eyes, Raymond turns back to his numbers. Graciella waits till McCaleb is close enough, lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: So. McCALEB I’m not sure yet, but it looks promising.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: When will you know? McCaleb shrugs his shoulders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB Soon, I hope. McCaleb retrieves his pills from a cabinet, grabs some orange juice from the fridge. Graciella watches with something close to pity as he washes them down. McCALEB What?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Thank you. For what you’re doing. McCaleb looks down at the fillets. McCALEB I’m impressed.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: My father took Glory and me fishing when we were kids. She smiles at the memory, catches herself.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: I’m glad I can smile about her. I couldn’t at first. They look at each other a beat.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. -- I mean, Terry. As McCaleb looks over, Raymond points at the laminated newspaper lineup of "Code Killer Victims." Specifically at the "903 472 568."

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: What’s this? McCALEB That’s just, ah -- like a code. You have to try and break the code. Um, I never could.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: There’s no one. McCALEB What?

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: 9-0-3-4-7-2-5-6-8. It’s all the numbers, but no one. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCaleb steps over. He’s intrigued even if... McCALEB I never thought of that before. You’re right. Graciella joins them.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: It’s getting late. McCALEB Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Raymond was wondering if we could sleep here. Surprised, McCaleb looks at her. McCALEB Sure. I got plenty of berths.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND 91
dialogues.text: asleep in a bunk. Graciella steps over, pulls the blanket up under his chin. She heads off, barefoot, wearing a man’s shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb lies on his back, bare-chested. He watches Graciella as she returns, climbs back into bed. As she snuggles to his side, we know we missed something. McCaleb reaches down, gently touches her face. McCALEB Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Yes. A long beat until a short, involuntary laugh escapes McCaleb’s lips.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What’s so funny? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB Nothing. I’m just happy, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Good. She rests her head against his chest. As she listens to her sister’s heart beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fog has rolled in, shrouding the boats in a ghostly veil. As a gray shadow moves down the dock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a sneaker-clad foot steps stealthily down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb, asleep beside Graciella, shifts, wakes as the boat tells him someone is walking on the deck above. An instant and then McCaleb rolls out and down to his feet. As Graciella wakes, whispers...

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? McCALEB (whispers back) Someone’s up on deck.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: Raymond? McCALEB Too heavy. Graciella reaches out, grips McCaleb’s arm. McCALEB It’ll be okay. Go to him. As she rolls out of bed, McCaleb starts away.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND 96
dialogues.text: Still asleep in his berth. McCaleb’s shadow passes by.  97 98 99 100 101 80.

dialogues.speaker: SALON 97
dialogues.text: McCaleb retrieves his .38, starts for the forward hatch. As he clears, we see a shadow outside the salon door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opens and McCaleb slips out.

dialogues.speaker: DECK 99
dialogues.text: As the shadow reaches for the door handle, McCaleb drops down from above. The shadow is flattened. McCaleb hauls whoever it is to his feet, slams him face first against the bulkhead. At the same time... A SECOND FIGURE appears at the rail.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: Freeze! McCaleb flings figure #1 into Figure #2. There are two nearly simultaneous SPLASHES as both go over the side. McCaleb grabs a spotlight, shines it on the water.

dialogues.speaker: SPOT-LIT WATER 100
dialogues.text: Spitting almost as much water as they’re treading -- Arrango and Walters. Arrango looks up at McCaleb, furious, blood trickling down his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: When this is over, it’s you and me, old man! When this is over! McCaleb considers him a beat, then... McCALEB When what is over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running behind several small businesses at the edge of a neighborhood. Police lines have been set up. It’s something big because a horde of media have arrived and two news choppers circle overhead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCaleb arrives with a still-damp Walters and Arrango. As they hustle him along, he’s spotted by a REPORTER

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: McCaleb! Did you think this was over?! As McCaleb wonders what he means...

dialogues.speaker: CHAIN LINK FENCE 102
dialogues.text: McCaleb nears; he can see that a corpse lies before it. He realizes something. McCALEB Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: WALTERS
dialogues.text: What? McCALEB (to himself) This is where I had my heart attack. McCaleb stops short as a police photographer flashes the fence. A crude banner has been hung. It’s covered with a series of bloody hand-painted numbers.
Under that, the words: "Dear McCaleb, Happy Valentine’s Day." McCaleb can’t believe it. As the three of them step up...

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Your Code Killer’s back in business.

dialogues.speaker: WALTERS
dialogues.text: (re: body) It’s James Lockeridge. The guy who found Cordell at the A.T.M. machine.

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Way to make a comeback, McCaleb. McCaleb doesn’t answer. His head swims. Suddenly, he wheels to where the crowd watches. A few dozen faces. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then he starts forward, his eyes peeled on their shoes. There! Second row back! Converse high-tops! But they don’t run and they’re not covered with blood. And as McCaleb grabs a state college student by the throat and hauls him out of the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 103
dialogues.text: Beyond, four cops restrain McCaleb.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: ... Former F.B.I. agent Terrel McCaleb at a murder scene in Silverlake. The victim may well be the eighth of the legendary Code Killer. If so, it would be the first in over two years. Agent McCaleb was at the center of that investigation when it gripped the Southland... McCALEB 104 wheels off to the side over by a trash pile. A big commotion stirred up. Without warning, McCaleb draws his 38.

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO AND WALTERS 105
dialogues.text: Reacting, as... McCALEB 106 FIRES. Into a bundle of newspapers. He pulls out a pocketknife, begins to dig the slug out of the wadding. As Arrango and Walters near, he’s handing them the slug. McCALEB Ballistics. It’1l match the slug found in Bolotov’s mouth. It’s the Code Killer for all of it. Graciella Rivers, James Cordell, Bolotov, all of it...

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Talk fucking English, man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB I shot him. Two years ago. And now I’m back and so is he.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb, patience strapped, faces off across from Arrango, Walters, a POLICE CAPTAIN and two other detectives. McCALEB Look, every second you talk to me, is one you could use to canvas the neighborhood, looking for this sonuvabitch.

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, pops, we got plenty of guys on that. McCALEB You’re right. We got a much better chance breaking this with you in here off the street.

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Fuck you, bureau man.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Enough on that, Detective!

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: (glaring at McCaleb) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: McCaleb, this Code Killer likes to impress you. Any idea why? McCALEB I had a media profile. So did he. I think he liked the match up. Me versus him. On the news every night.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I thought once these guys started, they didn’t stop. But your Codie’s been down for two years. What do you make of it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB To be honest, Captain, I shot him. I always figured he crawled off somewhere and died.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What do the numbers mean? McCALEB Don’t know. We ran it through computers up at Cal. We talked to code-breakers at the N.S.A. It doesn’t mean anything to anyone but him. Except...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Except what? McCALEB There’s no digit one. No one. Whatever that means. As McCaleb starts to drift in thought...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Cop to cop. What’s going on here? McCALEB Cordell. Gloria Torres. He did them for me.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Keep talking till I understand. McCALEB He missed the action. Me and him. To get it back, I needed a new heart. So... Happy Valentine’s Day.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Holy shit... McCALEB And now the love letters are going to start hot and heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A detective’s unmarked pulls up. Walters and Arrango are up front. McCaleb gets out of the back. As he starts away, Arrango talks after him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARRANGO
dialogues.text: Know what, pops? You got Graciella Rivers’ heart. That makes you suspect number one in my book. McCaleb doesn’t respond, just keeps walking. Arrango and Walters pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb enters. McCALEB Graciella? Raymond? They’re gone. McCaleb heads to the galley, chucks down a dozen pills, swigs them down with a gulp of orange juice. From somewhere, BLUES HARMONICA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb leans out. The MUSIC’s coming from the Double Down. He’1ll talk to Buddy. But as he starts, he remembers something.

dialogues.speaker: CORK BOARD 111
dialogues.text: McCaleb pulls Buddy’s check off the board. He can’t help but see the Code Killer’s Code at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DOUBLE DOWN - day 112 The MUSIC’s coming from inside. McCaleb approaches. McCALEB Hey, Buddy!

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I’m in here, Terry.  113 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As messy inside as it is out. Buddy lays out ona cushion playing his harmonica. He grins as McCaleb steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Welcome to Davey Jones’s locker. As McCaleb glances about... McCALEB Did you see Graciella and Raymond this morning?

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Got tired of waiting for you. They left an hour ago. You’re all over the news, brother. McCaleb picks up a cheap, beaded necklace from a tray of trinkets. Looks it over. McCALEB How long have we been neighbors, Buddy?

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I moved into the marina a week after you did, remember? McCALEB Yeah. Take off your shirt, Buddy.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: What? McCaleb raises his .38, cocks back the hammer. McCALEB Do it. A little smile from Buddy. Then he pulls off his T- shirt. McCALEB Let me see it. Buddy half-turns. On his left shoulder: the scar from a bullet wound.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (laughing) I’m the Following Sea, man. The one you need to watch out for. When did you figure it out? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB Just now. No one... McCaleb holds out Buddy’s check. Jasper Noone. A slash through the Noone: "No/one" Buddy the serial killer smiles, proud of McCaleb.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I could have killed you if I wanted to, Terry. I was behind you at the A.T.M. I followed you to Sherman Market. Just like I followed Gloria Torres. McCALEB You sick sonuvabitch.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I studied her, chose her. She was my Valentine to you. I gave you life. McCaleb sets the necklace down with the trinkets. God knows where they came from. McCaleb steps forward, aims the gun directly at Buddy’s head. He doesn’t have to say anything; he’s going to shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: You’re mine forever, Terry. Every breath you take belongs to me. Every beat of that stolen heart is the echo of my voice in your head. Every day... McCaleb rests the barrel on Buddy’s forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: ... always... McCaleb cocks back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: It all depends on you now. Pull the trigger and you’1ll never see them again. McCALEB What? Buddy’s eyes flicker to the left. McCaleb follows them to Raymond’s fishing pole. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB (in doubt) You have a fishing pole. It’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Kill me and no one will find them. They die alone in a black hole and that’s on you... You know me. You know I have them. A beat. McCaleb sets back the hammer, lowers the gun. McCALEB What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (standing) I want you to live. I want me to live. I want it all to start again. The battle between good and evil. Can’t you see I’ve been watching over you? Taking care of you? We were meant to be, Terry. Buddy pockets the harmonica and picks up his car keys. McCaleb doesn’t know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I have to leave now. And you won’t follow. You’1l stay by the pay phone and I’11 call you from time to time. When I’m relocated and ready, I’11 let Graciella and Raymond go. Then you and me start again. Buddy smiles sadly at McCaleb.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I hope you think of me as often as I’1l1 think of you. Buddy turns, starts to go. McCaleb watches a beat. Then, without warning, he raises the .38 and FIRES. Buddy goes down in a heap, half inside, and half out. He twists a look up as McCaleb looms.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: You’re crazy! Buddy’s been shot through the lower left bicep. He looks aghast as the blood pulses from the wound. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance. McCaleb looks at him, sees the Converse high-tops he wears. McCaleb reaches down, hauls Buddy to his feet. McCALEB Show me where they are.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I gotta get to the hospital! Slam! McCaleb flings Buddy against the galley stove. McCaleb fishes the belt off Buddy’s jeans. Looping it, he cinches it high up Buddy’s left arm, just below grabs the armpit. He pulls it taut, gives Buddy the end to hold. McCALEB That’1l pinch off the artery. You keep the pressure there, you won’t bleed to death. McCaleb releases him. McCALEB Now. Show me. Buddy looks down at his shattered arm. The bleeding has stopped. He looks back to McCaleb, suddenly calmed.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Following Sea makes her way out through the chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb is at the wheel, his .38 gripped in his right hand. Buddy leans against the rail, still holding the belt tight around the arm. Where they’re going is a mystery. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I know all about this boat. How it used to belong to your old man. How you grew up on Catalina. Everything. McCaleb doesn’t answer. After a beat...

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: You don’t look so good, Terry. McCaleb offers Buddy a grim smile. McCALEB Neither do you, Buddy. Looking ahead, McCaleb spots something. He raises a pair of binoculars, takes a quick look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobbing in the water -- a can buoy.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE 117
dialogues.text: Buddy watches McCaleb, but the binoculars come down too quick for him to make a move. McCaleb adjusts course for the buoy.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Do you really think you have a chance? McCaleb looks over, but doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: I mean, with her. Do you really think she could love you? Her sister died for you, Terry. That’s gonna be a tough one for her to get around. McCaleb isn’t going to bite. He looks ahead, increases speed. As Buddy smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large can with a padlocked hatch. There’s a cage tower and light built atop it. B.g., the Following Sea approaches.  119 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb THROTTLES BACK as he nears the buoy. He then looks over at Buddy. McCALEB Scratch your nose and I’11 shoot it off. MOVE WITH McCaleb as he moves down the ladder to the deck rail. Using a gaff hook he latches onto the buoy, ties off to it with a deck line. There’s a padlocked hatch on the can. McCaleb gives the lock a tug, BANGS on the CAN with the MUZZLE of the .38. McCALEB Graciella! Raymond! A horrible beat goes by. Then a MUFFLED BANG and a faint response.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: McCaleb! McCaleb looks back to the bridge at Buddy. McCALEB (re: padlock) Key. Buddy reaches into his pocket, pulls out his keyring. Before McCaleb can move, Buddy tosses them. They seem like they’re going overboard when -- -- McCaleb catches them. He gives a look that could kill, then starts at the LOCK. One, two, and then the third KEY... CLICK. McCaleb pulls off the lock, throws back the hatch. McCALEB Graciella!

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: McCaleb... Climbing up an inside ladder, Graciella appears. Half- way out, she throws an arm around him. McCALEB Raymond? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: He’s down here. He’s okay. McCaleb looks back up to the bridge: Buddy is nowhere to be seen. A beat. McCaleb looks back at Graciella. McCALEB Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: What is it? McCALEB Buddy’s on the boat. Stay here. McCaleb looks at her a beat, then unties the line. He gives her the gaff hook, then shoves off from the buoy. As he turns to survey his boat...

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: McCaleb? McCaleb. McCaleb looks back. They lock eyes. McCALEB It’1ll be okay. Graciella nods, believes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb steps up, looks to either side of the boat. No Buddy lurking on the sides. McCaleb climbs over and onto the bridge. He’s not hiding beneath the wheel either.

dialogues.speaker: LADDER 121
dialogues.text: As McCaleb’s feet come down.

dialogues.speaker: SALON SLIDING DOOR 122
dialogues.text: McCaleb pauses at the half-open door, a bloody hand print on the glass. McCaleb’s about to ease his way through when he hesitates. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He swallows hard, rubs his left arm. And his heart begins to pound. McCaleb takes several deep breaths, quells the beating away out of sheer will. Finally, he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of Buddy. McCaleb leans back to see behind the galley bench... Nothing. He looks over into the galley... The knife block... A blade is missing... A bloody thumb print on the wood. Leading with the .38, McCaleb continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb moves along. The first door is open. McCaleb peeks in on the stateroom where Raymond slept. It’s empty. McCaleb moves along.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON BUDDY’S EYES 125 Gleaming. A slash of light across them. But we can’t tell whether he’s watching or waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb steps to the door to his own cabin. There’s blood on the handle... With the .38 poised, McCaleb grabs the knob, turns it. But as he leans in...

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER DOOR 127
dialogues.text: Behind him explodes as Buddy bursts out. He slams into McCaleb’s back, sends him sprawling into his cabin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Buddy slams the door behind him, goes about wedging it shut against the bulkhead with an oxygen tank from the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb shakes his head once to clear it, rolls and FIRES at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy hits the deck as THREE BULLETS STITCH through the WALL. Getting to his feet, he scrambles off, his oxygen tank wedge in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb gets to his feet, tries the door, then slams up against it. Once, twice... It won’t budge. McCaleb stops to catch his breath, his heart pounding. Then, almost as if he senses it, he looks up. McCALEB’S POV - HATCH 131 A small ventilation hatch. Buddy stands over it on deck, looking down at McCaleb, the end of the belt/tourniquet held between his smiling teeth. He dives OUT OF SIGHT as... McCALEB 132 FIRES! McCaleb then listens a beat. It’s quiet except for the LOW THROTTLE of the DIESEL. Suddenly, the ENGINE REVS UP and McCaleb almost falls as the boat lurches forward. Buddy’s moving the boat.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You make me sad, Terry! You make me very sad! But two can play at that game! McCaleb grits his teeth, slams himself into the door. Two lives depend on it.  133 134 135 136 137 138 139 140 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody Buddy at the wheel, the kitchen knife tucked in his belt. The buoy is 100 yards ahead. Graciella and Raymond cling to the cage.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: McCaleb! McCaleb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb turns himself into a human battering ram. Splinters form. He clutches his heart -- that hurt. Then: one final attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tank drops as the door comes apart. McCaleb stumbles against the bulkhead, then takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb flies out, turns, the .38 raised toward the wheel. But Buddy isn’t there, even the boat’s headed forward at about ten knots. McCaleb turns at a SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind The Following Sea and getting smaller all the time. Buddy swam there. Graciella beats at him with the gaff hook and tries to pull himself a top the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb scrambles up the ladder, turns the wheel hard over. As the boat comes about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy grabs Graciella, flings her into the water. As Raymond tries to go after her, Buddy grabs hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCaleb reverses the prop as he noses up to the buoy. Braced against the swell of the sea, he aims the .38.  141 142 143 144 96.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY 141
dialogues.text: Holds Raymond in front of him, the kitchen knife up under the boy’s throat. There’s no delicate way to put it: the belt is gone and Buddy is bleeding like a pig.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: Everyday. Always. His grip on the knife tightens. McCALEB 142 As the BOW of The Following Sea SCRAPES against the BUOY. McCALEB (under his breath) Ten ring... BOOM! He FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY 143
dialogues.text: Blinks as the knife slips from his hand. He’s been shot through the heart. Raymond scrambles to Graciella who’s pulling herself back onto the can.

dialogues.speaker: THE FOLLOWING SEA 144
dialogues.text: Buddy falls forward, grips the rail of the boat. McCaleb steps forward. The two men are nearly face to face.

dialogues.speaker: BUDDY
dialogues.text: (a whisper) I saved you. I gave you life. McCALEB No, no, no. I traded you for me. I saved myself. With that, McCaleb covers Buddy’s face with his hand and shoves him into the water. Buddy takes one gulp, then sinks under the surface. McCaleb grips the cage as Graciella passes Raymond over, then scrambles aboard herself. McCaleb wraps his arms around them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB It’s over. He won’t hurt anybody ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Following Sea has just docked. McCaleb stands on the dock, tying off a final line. He looks up as Jaye Winston walks over.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Great timing. I just came down here to see you. Jaye stops short as she sees McCaleb looks like he just got back from World War III.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? McCALEB Haven’t felt this good in years. (stands) What can I do for you, Jaye?

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: I’1l give you three guesses. They all start with Code Killer. McCALEB And?

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: I thought I’d pick your brain. Where do you think he is? McCALEB In the wind I guess. Jaye studies him a moment. She then looks to The Following Sea. THROUGH the salon door, she can see Graciella holding Raymond. They’ve been through the wringer.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: The two of them okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McCALEB They will be if everyone leaves them alone. The best thing that could happen to them is if this Code Killer just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. The wind doesn’t blow forever. He’s got to come down some time. McCaleb looks away from her and out to the sea. follows his gaze. McCALEB Hope so. Jaye’s not stupid; she knows something.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: There’s blood all over the dock back there. And on your shirt. 98. 145 Jaye The two of them look at each other again and in that moment, a silent transmission and understanding.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Must’ve been a big fish. Finally, Jaye looks back to Graciella and Raymond. She nods,

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: It’s none of my business, but how are you going to deal with this? McCALEB I have Gloria Torres’ heart. I’m thinking it might guide me. squeezes McCaleb’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: Hope I don’t see you around, McCaleb. McCALEB Likewise, Detective Winston.

dialogues.speaker: JAYE
dialogues.text: ‘Bye. As she starts away, McCaleb looks back to Graciella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cutting across the low swells. McCaleb up on the bridge braced against the wheel. Looking hard and healthy against the wind. Just when we think he’s all alone... He looks over his shoulder to...

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT 147
dialogues.text: Raymond sits in the fighting chair, his small hands gripping the trolling set.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE 148
dialogues.text: Graciella comes up the ladder, hands McCaleb a steaming cup of coffee. They both look back at Raymond. McCALEB If I could will a big black marlin onto that line I would. Graciella smiles at McCaleb, slides an arm around his waist.

dialogues.speaker: GRACIELLA
dialogues.text: There’s going to be plenty of time to catch fish. As he smiles at her...

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT 149
dialogues.text: The line goes taut.

dialogues.speaker: RAYMOND
dialogues.text: I got one! I got one! A huge grin on the boy’s face and... FREEZE FRAME. FADE OUT.
